channel.title: Java Null Pointer Exception

item.title: Java Null Pointer Exception
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Hi I have a PKBox on my server, and this code checks if the attack and the victim are in the box.:

if (inPkBox == true && AttackingOn2.inPkBox == false) { sendMessage("You can't attack players that aren't in the Pking Box!"); ResetAttack(); }
But, if you attack a player out of the box, instead of the sendMessage, the server crashes with a Java NullPointer Exception. (And AttackingOn2 IS set to the client that is being attacked.) public boolean Attack() { int EnemyX = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX; int EnemyY = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY; int EnemyHP = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].playerLevel[playerHitpoints]; int EnemyHPExp = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].playerXP[playerHitpoints]; client AttackingOn2 = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn]; client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[AttackingOn]; boolean RingOfLife = false; if (PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].playerEquipment[playerRing] == 2570) { RingOfLife = true; } if (inPkBox == true && AttackingOn2.inPkBox == false) { sendMessage("You can't attack players that aren't in the Pking Box!"); ResetAttack(); }

Any idea on what I did wrong?

Read full topic
